title: MATLAB API hx_connect() command from ethernet-connected computer returns error

content.raw:
I am trying to use the MATLAP API from a computer connected to the Gazebo machine. When I try to connect by executing hx_connect(), an error is returned:

Error using hxgz
The error message identifier is invalid.

Error in hx_connect (line 25)
  hxgz('connect');

I configured the ~/.bashrc file on the Linux machine properly, and I edited the environment variables on the Windows machine running MATLAB R2014b according to the networking tutorial. IGN_PARTITION is named haptix-osrf-02 on both machines. IGN_IP in the ~/.bashrc file matches the inet address found via an ifconfig call to the command prompt. IGN_IP in the environment variable matches the IPv4 address on the Windows machine found via an ipconfig call to the command prompt.

Both machines can ping each other over the command prompts.

I am trying to use the MATLAP API from a computer connected to the Gazebo machine. When I try to connect by executing hx_connect(), an error is returned:

Error using hxgz The error message identifier is invalid.

Error in hx_connect (line 25) hxgz('connect');

I configured the ~/.bashrc file on the Linux machine properly, and I edited the environment variables on the Windows machine running MATLAB R2014b according to the networking tutorial. IGN_PARTITION is named haptix-osrf-02 on both machines. IGN_IP in the ~/.bashrc file matches the inet address found via an ifconfig call to the command prompt. IGN_IP in the environment variable matches the IPv4 address on the Windows machine found via an ipconfig call to the command prompt.

Both machines can ping each other over the command prompts.
